TECHNIQUE.name: Variable from JSON file (dict)
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION:
Read and merge successive local or remote JSON files to define a local variable. You can use these variables in the form ${your_namespace.variable_name}. The technique will start by defining a the variable with the "base file", which is mandatory. Then, it will try to override this variable with the successive merge of the "override files". If a an "override file" could not be found, it will not prevent the variable creation but will report an error.If an "override files" entry is left blank/empty, it will not prevent the variable definition and will report a "not applicable" report for this specific file.
For example a JSON containing { "datacenter": "paris" } read into the variable "machine_info" with prefix "my_company" can be used as ${my_company.machine_info[datacenter]}. Note that the syntax will differ in a mustache template: {{{vars.my_company.machine_info.datacenter}}}.

REGEX.error: The variable name must be of the form my_prefix.my_name

INPUT.NAME: VARIABLE_FROM_JSON_FILE_BASE_FILE
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Path relative to /var/rudder/configuration-repository/shared-files/ for remote sources. Absolute path for local ones.

INPUT.NAME: VARIABLE_FROM_JSON_FILE_JSON_FILE
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Path relative to /var/rudder/configuration-repository/shared-files/ for remote sources. Absolute path for local ones. It will override the previous one if necessary.
